page.title: 04TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: WE COUNTED TRAFFIC AT ALL THE ENTRIES AND EXITS TO BATTLE FOR 15 MINUTES IN THE MORNING. WE DISCOVERED THAT THE MAIN ROADS WERE BUSIER THAN THE SIDE ROADS. 200 VEHICLES PASSED THROUGH BATTLE TOWN CENTRE EVERY 15 MINUTES. MOST OF THESE WERE CARS, BUT VANS AND LORRIES WERE COMMON TOO.COACHES AND BUSES BRING TOURISTS TO THE TOWN, BUT MOST VEHICLES CARRIED PEOPLE COMING TO WORK OR GOING SHOPPING. MORE VEHICLES LEFT THE TOWN THAN ENTERED IT IN THE COUNT TIME, BECAUSE PEOPLE WERE FINISHING THEIR SHOPPING AND GOING HOME FOR LUNCH. WE CALCULATED THAT 4000 VEHICLES GO THROUGH BATTLE IN EACH DIRECTION EVERY WORKING DAY,WE THOUGHT THAT BATTLE NEEDED MORE CAR PARKS.THERE ARE NOT ENOUGH ZEBRA CROSSINGS. THE ONLY CROSSING IS OUTSIDE THE POST OFFICE.
